io.github.nucleuspowered.nucleus.api.service

Interface NucleusJailService


  • public interface NucleusJailService
    A service that handles subject jailing.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String JAIL_CONTEXT
      The permission context key that indicates which jail a player is in.
      static java.lang.String JAILED_CONTEXT
      The permission context key that indicates a player is jailed.

    • Field Detail

      • JAILED_CONTEXT

        static final java.lang.String JAILED_CONTEXT
        The permission context key that indicates a player is jailed.

        The value of this context will always be true if set.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JAIL_CONTEXT

        static final java.lang.String JAIL_CONTEXT
        The permission context key that indicates which jail a player is in.

        The value of this context will be the name of the jail.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setJail

        boolean setJail(java.lang.String name,
                org.spongepowered.api.world.Location<org.spongepowered.api.world.World> location,
                com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d rotation)
        Sets a jail location in the world.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the jail to use.
        location - The Location in a world for the jail.
        rotation - The rotation of the subject once in jail.
        Returns:
        true if the creation of a jail point was a success.

      • getJails

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,NamedLocation> getJails()
        Gets the name of the jails on the server. All jails returned in this map exist.
        Returns:
        A Map of names to NamedLocation.

      • getJail

        java.util.Optional<NamedLocation> getJail(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the location of a jail, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the jail to get. Case in-sensitive.
        Returns:
        An Optional that potentially contains the NamedLocation if the jail exists.

      • removeJail

        boolean removeJail(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a jail location from the list.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the jail to remove.
        Returns:
        true if successful.

      • isPlayerJailed

        boolean isPlayerJailed(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.User user)
        Returns whether a subject is jailed.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to check.
        Returns:
        true if the subject is jailed.

      • getPlayerJailData

        java.util.Optional<Inmate> getPlayerJailData(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.User user)
        Returns information about why a subject is jailed, if they are indeed jailed.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to check
        Returns:
        An Optional that will contain Inmate information if the subject is jailed.

      • jailPlayer

        boolean jailPlayer(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.User victim,
                   java.lang.String jail,
                   org.spongepowered.api.command.CommandSource jailer,
                   java.lang.String reason)
            throws NoSuchLocationException
        Jails a subject if they are not currently jailed.
        Parameters:
        victim - The user to jail.
        jail - The jail to send the user to.
        jailer - The jailing entity.
        reason - The reason for jailing.
        Returns:
        true if the subject was jailed successfully.
        Throws:
        NoSuchLocationException - if the jail does not exist.

      • unjailPlayer

        boolean unjailPlayer(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.User user)
        Unjails a subject if they are currently jailed.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to unjail.
        Returns:
        true if the subject was unjailed successfully.
